title: Energy Conservation and Transformations

vocab.definition: Principle that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed
Stored energy due to position or condition
Sum of kinetic and potential energy in a system
Process of changing energy from one form to another

teachingNotes: Use everyday examples of energy transformations. Emphasize that total energy remains constant in isolated systems.

sample.question: What principle states that energy cannot be created or destroyed?
Give an example of kinetic energy.
Give an example of potential energy.
What happens to total energy in isolated system?

truefalse.question: Kinetic energy is the energy of motion. (True or False)
Energy can be created. (True or False)
Energy can be destroyed. (True or False)
Potential energy is stored energy. (True or False)
Mechanical energy is KE plus PE. (True or False)
Energy transformations change energy form. (True or False)
Total energy changes in isolated systems. (True or False)
Energy conservation means energy is constant. (True or False)
A moving object has kinetic energy. (True or False)
A raised object has potential energy. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What is stored energy due to position called?
What is energy of motion called?
What principle says energy cannot be created or destroyed?
What is changing energy from one form to another?
A rolling ball has what type of energy?
A book on a shelf has what type of energy?
What happens to total energy in isolated system?

fillintheblank.question: The sum of kinetic and potential energy is called _____ energy.
Stored energy due to position is _____ energy.
Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only _____.
The principle that energy is constant is energy _____.
Changing energy from one form to another is energy _____.
In an isolated system, total energy remains _____.

shortanswer.question: What does energy conservation mean?
expectedAny: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed

shortanswer.question: What is the difference between kinetic and potential energy?
expectedAny: Kinetic is motion, potential is stored
Kinetic is moving energy, potential is position energy
KE is motion, PE is position

shortanswer.question: What is mechanical energy?
expectedAny: Sum of kinetic and potential energy

shortanswer.question: Give an example of energy transformation.
What happens to energy when a ball rolls down a hill?
expectedAny: Energy transforms from potential to kinetic

shortanswer.question: What happens to energy when you lift a book?
Why is energy conservation important?
expectedAny: Total stays same in isolated system

shortanswer.question: What forms can energy take?
expectedAny: Kinetic, potential, thermal, chemical, and more
Many forms like motion, heat, light

shortanswer.question: In a pendulum, what energy transformations occur?
expectedAny: PE and KE transform back and forth
Energy alternates between PE and KE

shortanswer.question: What is an isolated system?
expectedAny: System where no energy enters or leaves
Closed system with no energy exchange
